conbody.p: Network Privileged Access Management (NPAM) allows the creation and the maintenance of the Maintenance Users (MU) of the node directly by ENM.
The Maintenance User is a user configured locally on the node, and its credentials can be used to connect to the node with high privileges for maintenance activities.
For each Network Element managed by the NPAM application, an NE Account object is created for each Maintenance User to store its credentials and status.

The NPAM feature is disabled by default and it must be enabled by a Security Administrator. There is also the option to enable a second Maintenance User to support the CBRS (Citizens Broadband Radio Service) functionality. Use the System Security Configuration UI interface for NPAM configuration management.
